text: The 1970–1971 Algerian Championnat National was the 9th season of the Algerian Championnat National since its establishment in 1962. A total of 16 teams contested the league, with CR Belcourt as the defending champions, The Championnat started on September 20, 1970. and ended on April 25, 1971. ==Team summaries== === Promotion and relegation === Teams promoted from Algerian Division 2 1970-1971 * MO Constantine * ASM Oran * Hamra Annaba * WA Tlemcen Teams relegated to Algerian Division 2 1971-1972 * No relegated ==League table== ==Season statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Scorer !Club !Goals |- !|1 |align="left"| Abdelkader Fréha |align="left"|MC Oran | style="text-align:center;"|15 |- !|2 |align="left"| Noureddine Hamel |align="left"|MC Oran | style="text- align:center;"|15 |- !|3 |align="left"| Kamel Tchalabi |align="left"|USM Alger | style="text-align:center;"|10 |- !|4 |align="left"| Hacène Lalmas |align="left"|CR Belcourt | style="text-align:center;"|10 |- !|5 |align="left"| Abderrahmane Meziani |align="left"|USM Alger | style="text- align:center;"|10 |- !|6 |align="left"| Hassan Tahir |align="left"|MC Alger | style="text-align:center;"|10 |} ==References== ==External links== *1970–71 Algerian Championnat National Category:Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1 seasons Category:1970–71 in Algerian football Algeria
title: 1970–71 Algerian Championnat National
